message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a vision-based learning-by-demonstration approach for robots to learn and complete a manipulation task cooperatively. The approach involves a vision system in both the task demonstration and reproduction stages, indicating a strong focus on robotics (cs.RO) and computer vision (cs.CV). The use of statistical models to encode demonstrations suggests a machine learning (cs.LG) component, while the adaptive optimization of sampling rates indicates an artificial intelligence (cs.AI) aspect. Finally, the mention of multi-robot cooperation implies a systems and control (cs.SY) element.
